title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Trump’s ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ is threatening to upend multi-billion dollar investments promising thousands of new jobs for a Georgia town
items.description: Republicans in Congress want to gut the subsidies for projects across the country in a tax cut bill.

items.title: NYC Legal Aid Society Lawyers Threaten to Strike for Higher Pay
items.description: The lawyers who represent the city’s poorest defendants want to be paid on par with their federal counterparts. They last walked out in 1994.

items.title: Ford workers told their CEO ‘none of the young people want to work here.’ So Jim Farley took a page out of the founder’s playbook
items.description: Ford founder Henry Ford decided in 1914 to more than double factory wages to $5 a day, jump-starting the American middle class.

items.title: Bob Vylan’s Chant Against Israel’s Military at Glastonbury Draws Criminal Inquiry

items.title: A father jumped overboard to save his daughter who fell from a Disney cruise ship returning to Florida
items.description: Crew members from a Disney cruise ship saved a girl who fell overboard and her father who jumped in after her.

items.title: Fordo Nuclear Site Work Taking Place in Iran, Satellate Images Show
items.description: Amid competing assessments of how badly the enrichment facility was damaged in U.S. strikes, Iran appears to be making its own inspection.

items.title: Nonprofits Lose Legal Bid to Halt U.K. Exports of Fighter Jet Parts to Israel
